messages: 22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (14:19): MarcoZ, can you do a mochitest and send me mochitest.log ?
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (14:19): that would help me a lot
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (14:22): surkov, can you tell me how do you invoke mochitests? what command
3fe145094f808469bffe4e30453f94c1 (14:40): askalski: What kind of indeterministic results do you get?
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (14:41): well, first, the outputs differs a lot, I'll post you just headers to give you a scale of problem
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (14:43): even numbers don't match! same compilation, same machine, same command...
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (14:43): of course as you can se the latter is over twice as long as the former
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (14:43): third test gave similar results as the second
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (14:43): btw, these 5 failures are probably introduced by patch I work on
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (14:44): I need to do something with that
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (14:46): surkov, the command you gave me hangs at my computer, while make -C objdir mochitest-a11y works
3fe145094f808469bffe4e30453f94c1 (14:51): askalski: First, the second and third runs sound about right.
3fe145094f808469bffe4e30453f94c1 (14:52): The first run sounds like Firefox crashed while executing the tests.

3fe145094f808469bffe4e30453f94c1 (14:54): askalski: I use a command like this to do an automated, unattended, test run: python ff-optimized-release/_tests/testing/mochitest/runtests.py --a11y --close-when-done --log-file="mochitest.log" --autorun --console-level=ERROR
3fe145094f808469bffe4e30453f94c1 (14:55): askalski: The first part is the name of my objdir.
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (14:55): MarcoZ, sounds reasonable, but tbsaunde|afk told me yesterday that we even dont have that number of tests
3fe145094f808469bffe4e30453f94c1 (14:55): askalski: So the round 21,000 tests and the 1166 to-dos sound about right to me.
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (14:55): MarcoZ, ok, second thing - the python command hangs before first test. the application is displayed but do not follow the script. tried twice
3fe145094f808469bffe4e30453f94c1 (14:56): askalski: If in doubt, always check tbpl.mozilla.org, grab any of the builds that run the a11y tests, and check the numbers in the log file yourself.
3fe145094f808469bffe4e30453f94c1 (14:56): askalski: Have you used my command line?
3fe145094f808469bffe4e30453f94c1 (14:56): That auto-runs the tests and then exits that instance of Firefox.
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (15:00): I'll post results in a moment
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (15:12): MarcoZ, the first run went fine, I'll do another two

3fe145094f808469bffe4e30453f94c1 (15:16): Folks, we seem to have at least one successful opt build run on projects/accessibility for Mac OS X, and I'm waiting for the first nightly build with mac a11y enabled to come out of that branch, too.
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (15:16): MarcoZ: did you land your patch?
3fe145094f808469bffe4e30453f94c1 (15:17): davidb: Modified the Mac-universal mozconfig to include accessibility for nightly and on-change builds only.
3fe145094f808469bffe4e30453f94c1 (15:17): davidb: And I also know where to modify the configure.in file to turn on accessibility for Mac permanently for all kinds of configs.
3fe145094f808469bffe4e30453f94c1 (15:18): Nick Thomas was so kind as to point me to the right spots.
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (15:21): MarcoZ, two in a row OK. now I run on a clean build. I honestly don't know what's the difference :/
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (15:21): I mean why it sometimes works and others not
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (15:22): askalski: are you talking about tests?
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (15:23): yes, the bug I am working on is all about tests
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (15:30): davidb, any clues when/where it comes from?
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (15:30): davidb, ok, so there has been some investigation, right? any bug numbers?
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (15:30): askalski: timing can be an issue I suppose, if the system is doing some cleanup or something.
47e87577fff6e08b0f2f43540db8c9c9 (15:34): Bug https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=518190 nor, --, ---, nobody, NEW, [meta] intermittent a11y test failures
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (15:35): davidb, ok, wow, I see you're working on it

22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (15:37): davidb, ok. I write a python script to compare test outputs so I can trace newly introduced errors faster (diff is not that useful) and once I finish with the bug, I can take a closer look on that
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (15:38): I usually just try to get a clean run (but not on mac)
3fe145094f808469bffe4e30453f94c1 (15:39): davidb: Well not long and we should be able to run the tests on Mac just the same.
